comment:
He is extremely knowledgeable about this course and is committed to imparting this knowledge to every student regardless of their background prior to taking the course.

I registered for this course with very little knowledge about it but completed it with so much knowledge that I am able to apply to my research with so much expertise.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: Dr. Carl Saint-Louis is very passionate about educating young minds especially those from underrepresented backgrounds. He treats his students with the utmost respect. He is most easily reached by email or his office hours. He helps prepare his students for the world by helping them become independent thinkers and problem solvers.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--Accessible outside class

comment: Foul attitude. Hangry. He favorites one group and treats everyone else awful. When glass breaks or there's a spill, he either hovers over your shoulder and watches you scramble to clean everything up, or he'll yell. God forbid you don't thoroughly understand all of the concepts and reactions already...despite this being your first organic chem lab.

Very thorough, provides ample of resources to help students be more than prepared for the exams. Makes himself available for office hours, utilizes the whole time to help with any questions related to course material. Provided extra-credit opps related to attendance. Attend every lecture, detailed notes, study hard, & know Organic Chemistry I.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Accessible outside class

comment: Attend class. The lectures/hw are EXACTLY like the tests. take good notes and he will give you extra credit on test. Extra credit provided for every test (thru attendance and participation, notes, etc.) Started rushing at end of course since we were behind...still pretty manageable.

Dr. Saint-Louis is an awesome professor. I am grateful for his willingness to allow me to work in his lab. I learned much from his strong, firm leadership, and I appreciate his guidance. Thanks for helping me with my project. Because of his professionalism and encouragement, I worked hard to obtain my Master's degree.

take any other ochem2 professor. problem sets & homework were easy, however the exams are extremely difficult & about 80% of the grade is short answer. basically no point including multiple choice. didnt provide practice exams, so it was really hard to study for. also very condescending & rude at times & will make you feel stupid.

I had Dr. S for lecture, not lab. He is an excellent professor. Truly passionate about what he does and wants students to learn and understand material. Not sure where the other reviews are coming from...
He is a tough grader and this course is hard in itself.

If you have any other option for professor, take it. Condescending, unnecessarily harsh grader, doesn't tell you what he wants and then takes off points when you don't do it, yells the entire lab period

Most difficult class I have ever had. He does not teach you anything. Don't ask him any questions because he gets mad and he expects you to know everything. I did not learn anything. Just a stressful class. Avoid!!!

He made it very clear that he's here for the research and not to teach. Gives procedures last minute if you're in Group A, gets mad when you aren't completely familiar with the procedure, will rush you, gives due dates last minute, and grades last minute. Had to mentally prepare myself before every lab because he wants to leave early and gets mad.

Ive taken my labs up to this point in my life at KSU, and hes been by far the worse lab professor Ive had. Hes super condensing, and if you ask for help he will just criticize you and tell you that you should have already learned this material in prior classes. I get that hes a new professor, but many of my classmates hated him. Hes no help

Dr. S is okay. He loves research, but not his students. He gets annoyed and mad quickly and expects you to be a pro at labs. Very strict and hard on you. Slow grader, and doesn't give feedback. Biggest flaw: RUSHES you because he is hungry and wants to go eat. But gotta say, first lab where I learned something. Tho, he could have been more patient

Overall, Dr. S is good. He has good days and bay days like everyone else. Likes to give lecture on procedure before lab, very helpful. Come prepare with a completed lab notebook. Make sure you ask for feedback on assignments, or he will not give much to you! Straight forward with assignments. Follow the directions and procedures. Youll make an A.
